intro: Discopodium penninervium var. nervisequum, commonly known as the narrow-veined discopodium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant features slender, upright stems with alternate, pinnately compound leaves that have distinct, parallel venation. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in compact umbels, typical of the carrot family. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in rock gardens and alpine settings.
